content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia

function wrap_string(text_to_wrap::String, text_width::Int=10)
    split_words = split(text_to_wrap)
    return join(text_width <= 0 ? split_words : split_words_and_apply(split_words, string -> wrap_word(string, text_width)), "\n")
end

function wrap_word(word::String, max_line_width::Int)
    if length(word) <= max_line_width
        word
    else
        s = string(word[1:max_line_width])

        while length(s) < length(word)
            while s[end] != " " && s[end] != "-"
                s = s[1:end-1]
            end
            s = string(s[1:end-1], word[max_line_width + length(s[1:end-1]):max_line_width + length(s[1:end-1]) + max_line_width])
        end
        s
    end
end

```
Example:
```julia
using DocStringExtensions
@doc wrap_string wrappings a string to fit in a maximum width

```
